thread.title: Alec Baldwin jokes about infamous voicemail to daughter | Page Six
thread.title_full: Alec Baldwin jokes about infamous voicemail to daughter | Page Six

author: Mara Siegler
title: Alec Baldwin jokes about infamous voicemail to daughter | Page Six
text:
Alec Baldwin, who’s been getting laughs as Donald Trump on “Saturday Night Live,” took to the stage at Carolines on Broadway Thursday as part of a stand-up show called “Bad Parent.” 
We hear the volatile actor aptly brought up that infamous voicemail to daughter Ireland, when he was caught calling her a “rude, thoughtless little pig.”
But he told the audience it was actually “a much, softer, sweeter version . . . I was driving through a canyon, so apparently it sounded different on her phone,” he cracked.
Baldwin teased more comedy shows with themes like “Bad Boyfriend.”
When an audience member suggested “Bad President,” he quipped, “Oh, I think we’d need to make that one a monthlong festival.”
